metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12205 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper certificate validation in Platform Sample/ Silicon Reference firmware for 8th Generation Intel(R) Core(tm) Processor, 7th Generation Intel(R) Core(tm) Processor may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable an escalation of privilege via physical access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> it is unclear whether this issue is addressed in cpu microcode or in other firmware, but if it is in cpu microcode, subsequent updates have addressed the issue.

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
